Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not before); 18TH DYNASTY; NEW KINGDOM (not after)
Name: Statue of the deceased Huemasha and his wife
Description: The scribe Huemasha is shown sitting on a seat with a high back, embracing his wife Baket, who embraces him in her turn; the latter is represented twice, on his right and on his left. The nine sons of the couple with their names are depicted on the back and sides of the seat.
